result.execSummary:
The defendant Deidrah Marie Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 12-21-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deidrah Marie Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deidrah Marie Jones in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 days in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days served FOR TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 12-21-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Defendant Deidrah Marie Jones in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Oral no contact order, Defendant to have no contact with James Unicorn Pub, Byron W. or Juana W.

Defendant Deidrah Marie Jones in court.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.    The case is adjourned to Br. 24 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/16/15 @ 1:30 pm
